oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Scene from "Wild River" shows the Garth family burying ground
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Movie still photograph of gravestones in a wooded area. Three markers are visible two are legible. At center right is James Baldwin. At center left is a stone for Laura Garth and Baby [Ham? Jim?].

The Garth family burying ground was fabricated by the [movie] magicians. Later, this hilltop was lopped off, put on a barge, and hauled out into Chickamauga Lake for a final shot. Directed by Elia Kazan, the movie starred Montgomery Clift and Lee Remick. The motion picture "Wild River" (1960) brought attention to the thousands of Tennesseans who had been forced to abandon their homes and land to make way for the Tennessee Valley Authority.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Tennessee Department of Conservation Photograph Collection, 1937-1976
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Motion pictures; cemeteries
